title: Without Qualification, One Cannot Become a Guru | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 2.2 | 12.08.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: Only Krishna can claim this because he is the Supreme personality of Godhead no living entity including Brahma Lord Shiva or Narayana can possess as fully as Krishna.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains the three phases of understanding the Absolute Truth: Brahman, Paramatma, and Bhagavan, culminating in Krishna as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, and contrasts Aryan and non-Aryan values.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes Krishna's supreme position as Bhagavan, refuting claims of equality and highlighting the authority of Vyasadeva as an incarnation of Narayana, while criticizing Mayavadi philosophers.

segments.key_quote: Vyāsadeva is writing śrī-bhagavān vāca where there is no cheating, no imperfection, no illusion, no mistake.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the importance of disciplic succession for receiving perfect knowledge, contrasting it with the four defects of those in the material world: mistakes, illusion, imperfect senses, and cheating, and emphasizing the perfection of Bhagavad-gita due to its divine source.

segments.key_quote: The only qualification is that I have tried to execute the order of superior authority, this is the secret of success.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains the Vedic process of receiving perfect knowledge through disciplic succession and emphasizes that becoming a spiritual master requires following the order of a superior authority, rather than personal qualification.

segments.key_quote: भगवान means person. भगवान is not imperson.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada defines a true sannyasi as one who works for Krishna without attachment to results, emphasizes that Bhagavan is personal, not impersonal, and explains the three features of the Absolute Truth.

segments.key_quote: Full understanding is Bhagavān. Therefore it is stated here, śrī-bhagavān vāca. There cannot be any mistake that is final.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that Bhagavan is the ultimate understanding of the Absolute Truth, criticizing Arjuna's material compassion and contrasting it with the spiritual perspective.

segments.key_quote: So, आर्ज्य means must make progress. अनार्ज्य means one who does not know what is progress of life.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the balance between killing and non-killing in Krishna consciousness, emphasizing the importance of making progress in life and contrasting Aryan and non-Aryan values.
